isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LUBRICATION AND SEALERS - ENGINE OIL SPECIFICATIONS - ENERGY CONSERVING OILS

svcproc.title: ENERGY CONSERVING OILS
svcproc.para:
Oils marketed as "Energy Conserving" are intended to improve fuel economy in passenger car engines. Some of these oils contain friction modifier chemical additives. One additive, molybdenum dithiophosphate, has been implicated in copper corrosion problems in some heavy duty diesel engines. Do not use an "Energy Conserving" oil containing molybdenum dithiophosphate in any International-built engine.
In addition, some "Energy Conserving" oils meet only API category SG for spark ignition engines, and do not meet the oil quality requirements for diesel engines.
